speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me when did you first start experiencing these symptoms - fatigue, malaise, and unintentional weight loss? Was it a gradual change or did it happen suddenly?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started about 6 months ago, and to be honest, I didn't think much of it at first. I just brushed it off as a busy schedule or a minor cold. But over time, it just kept getting worse, and the weight loss really started to take a toll on me."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the time frame over which these symptoms started - was it a few months ago, a year ago, or did they begin more recently?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's about 6 months now, I'd say. It's been a steady decline, with no clear turning point. The weight loss has been the most concerning part, as it's been quite significant."

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to perform a physical examination to get a better understanding of your overall condition. Can you please roll up your sleeve so I can take a look at your radial pulse?

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, I'll roll up my sleeve. Go ahead and take a look."

speaker: Doctor
text:
Let's take a closer look at your radial pulse. It seems to be within the normal range, but I do notice a slight irregularity in the rhythm - can you tell me if you've ever experienced any palpitations or irregular heartbeats?



Can you also tell me, have you experienced any other symptoms such as fever, night sweats, or swollen lymph nodes?



Also, have you recently traveled to any countries where infectious diseases are more common?

text:

"As for bowel movements, I haven't noticed anything out of the ordinary. I just eat a balanced diet and try to stay hydrated, but I guess I've lost some weight, so I'm eating less anyway."

"I do have to admit, I've been feeling a bit...off...at night, too. It's hard to describe, but I just feel a bit more tired than usual, even after a good night's sleep."
